revised_title: Electrical Conductivity and Luminosity of Flames Containing Vaporized Salts
tldr: The authors investigated the electrical conductivity and luminosity of flames containing vaporized salts. They found that the conductivity of salt vapors is of an electrolytic character, but it has features that distinguish it from electrolytic conduction in aqueous solutions. The conductivity of different salts varies based on their electropositive constituent, and the conductivity of haloid salts and oxy-salts behaves differently.
